alert.note: Alert for Martin; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Martin and northwestern Pike Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 259 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Coal Run Village, or near Pikeville, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Piso, Meta, Jarad and Heenan around 315 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Varney, Threeforks, Heisey, Conder, Sidney, Canada, Laura, Rural, Hatfield Station, Mcandrews, Forest Hills, Turkey Creek, Whitepost, Belfry, Huddy, Aflex and Hardy. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... U.S. Highway 119 in Pike County between mile markers 1 and 24. U.S. Highway 23 in Pike County between mile markers 25 and 31. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
